benchmark_details.name: R2SM (Referring and Reasoning for Selective Masks)
benchmark_details.overview: The R2SM dataset consists of both modal and amodal text queries, each paired with the corresponding ground-truth mask, enabling model finetuning and evaluation for the ability to segment images as per user intent.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a challenging and insightful testbed for advancing research in multimodal reasoning and intent-aware segmentation.

data.source: Constructed by augmenting annotations of COCOA-cls, D2SA, and MUV A.
data.annotation: Generated using the Claude API, employing a systematic methodology for text query generation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by comparing predicted masks to ground-truth masks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better overlap between predicted and ground-truth masks.
methodology.baseline_results: Fine-tuned models generally show improved performance on the dataset, indicating its utility in enhancing segmentation capabilities.
